summary: To be eligible for federal airport improvement grants, U.S. airports are not allowed to grant exclusive rights to any one company to provide aviation services—such as fuel—to the public. However, an airport may choose to be the exclusive provider of aviation services as long as they use their own employees and resources. How many airports are exercising the right to be the sole fuel provider...
title: Aviation Services: Information on Airports Exercising Their Right as the Sole Provider of Fuel
